pages.text: At the next Experiment, take some more seeds from the large box if necessary. There is a small box with a NET which you can use to catch 1 chicken at a time and place it somewhere else by using the right mouse button. You will need this for Experiment 2. Here we are going to have two identical chickens make 10 chicks and then arrange them by color in the appropriate cage.

The two gray chickens you will be working with are called Mendel and Craft. You have to leave them in their cage. Make a chick as in Experiment 1 and then use the NET and move the chick to the red dot in the correct cage. How many chickens do you have of each type? Write down your findings. But how is it possible that two identical chickens produce so many different colored chicks? Read Explanation 1.
